column1: 80045%TAB%989483426%TAB%28145%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Bugzilla-General%TAB%Query Page fails when email is non-existant and the matching is exact..%TAB%Query Page fails when email is non-existant and the matching is exact..Overview Description: In Bugzilla's (2.12) query page when an entry is made in  the text box called Email for a  user that does not exist and the matching is  made as "exact" bugzilla konks.  Steps to Reproduce: Go to the Query page
column3: enter an invalid user/email  (like "hellothere") for the "Email" text box and then choose the matching pull- dowb option as "exact".  Actual Result: Should maybe come back with a clean error saying no such user.  Expected Result: Get the Internal server error. I can send the apache logs also  if needed.  Additional Information: I can look into this and see if I can get a patch out.  What's happening:   Bugzilla does a check to see if it can output the "Bugzilla is pondering your   Query" message (which only works w/Mozilla and Netscape).  If it can
column4: it does   If it can't
column5: it spits out an incomplete header (so it can push more info later   if it needs to).  Somewhere after doing that
column6: it checks to see if the "exact"   e-mail address matches one in the database
column7: if it doen't the scripts errors   out and exists (telling the user that the "exact" e-mail address isn't in the   database).  The problem is that the error routine expects that the header has   already been completely outputted (the blank line has already happened).  How this patch fix it:   Before spitting out the error (and only if the error is gonna be spit out) it   sends a blank line.  This will complete the header and makes everyone happy.   This blank line won't have any adverse effects elsewhere because it'll only   show up in the HTML source
column8: not on the page itself.  While this isn't a security issue
column9: per se
column10: 500 errors are something to avoid and the fix is simple
column11: so I'm marking it 2.14.

column1: 80169%TAB%989510786%TAB%27300%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Requirements%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Creating/Changing Bugs%TAB%[RFE] JavaScript-enhanced keyword editing
column3: JavaScript-enhanced keyword editing%TAB%[RFE] JavaScript-enhanced keyword editing
column4: JavaScript-enhanced keyword editingIt should be possible to use JavaScript to significantly improve the editing of the keywords field (while maintaining backwards compatibility for users without JavaScript).  Among other solutions to this problem
column5: it is possible to use JavaScript to create two drop-down menus next to the keywords field.  The first menu contains a list of keywords currently in the field
column6: while the second menu contains a list of all possible keywords.  When the user selects a keyword from the first ("remove") menu
column7: that keyword is removed from the field.  When the user selects a keyword from the second ("add") menu
column8: that keyword is added to the field.  When the user edits the keyword field manually
column9: those edits are reflected in the "remove" menu
column10: so that menu and the field are always in sync.  Future enhancements to this feature could include:  1. Displaying tool-tip descriptions of keywords as the user mouses over them in the menus or the field; 2. Preventing a user from manually typing in an invalid keyword or from entering a keyword twice (either manually or via the "add" menu); and  3. Reducing UI clutter by only having an "add" menu (since removing a keyword is arguably easy to accomplish manually
column11: at least for those bugs whose list of keywords is not longer than the length of the field).  But these enhancements are icing on the cake.  Even without them this feature would make it significantly easier to edit the keywords field.

column1: 80183%TAB%989514203%TAB%18827%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Requirements%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Bugzilla-General%TAB%configurable index page [patch]
column3: configurable index page (using Template Toolkit)%TAB%configurable index page [patch]
column4: configurable index page (using Template Toolkit)This is an enhancement request (with patch providing the functionality) to add a new 'index.cgi' script that can replace or supplement the existing index.html static html file.  By having the main index page be a cgi program rather than static html
column5: we can take advantage of the configuration params (like bannerhtml) which makes it far easier for sites to customize the HTML associated with their deployed version of Bugzilla.  I will attach to this bug two files: a new "index.cgi" file
column6: and a patch to the defparams.pl file that adds a new "index-template" param that contains the html to be displayed on the index page.  In addition
column7: the attached index.cgi file can (optionally) display a table of the products that are part of this Bugzilla instance.  If that table is shown
column8: the product names can optionally be links to a query for all of the bugs for that product.  These optional features are turned off by default in order to emulate the original behavior of Bugzilla as closely as possible.  Although this is not even close to a solution for separating UI from application logic
column9: it does help a bit by making it easier to upgrade Bugzilla without having to reimplement HTML changes in the index.html file.  A solution more along the lines of Bug 49225 in which XML is converted to HTML using a user-specified set of XSLT stylesheets would be preferable but more disruptive to implement.  See bug 2900 and bug 51100 for related issues.

column1: 80289%TAB%989568793%TAB%12919%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Architecture%TAB%Bugzilla

column1: 82143%TAB%990518972%TAB%21302%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Architecture%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Creating/Changing Bugs%TAB%Reversing dependencies is difficult
column3: Reversing dependencies causes "circular dependency chain" error%TAB%Reversing dependencies is difficult
column4: Reversing dependencies causes "circular dependency chain" errorThis is probably in part a side-effect of the fix for bug 51670.  If I have two related bugs
column5: and make bug 1 depend on bug 2
column6: and then later  realise that I meant it the other way round (e.g. typed into the wrong field)
column7: it is not possible to reverse the dependency in a single step.  Intuitively I would expect to be able to delete the '2' from the "depends on"  of bug 1
column8: type '2' into the "blocks"
column9: and submit the form.  Bugzilla tells me that "The change you are making to dependencies has caused a  circular dependency chain."
column10: when in fact it has not
column11: but merely reversed the  direction of the existing chain.  In order to acheive the required operation
column12: I have to first remove one  dependency and then add the other as a separate operation which makes it less  obvious what is happening in the bugmails.

column1: 82497%TAB%990641495%TAB%4897%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Requirements%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Bugzilla-General%TAB%Stranded Params%TAB%Stranded ParamsIn the course of fixing bug 71552 it came up that when a Param is removed from defparam.pl it never gets removed from data/params.  While this shouldn't cause an problems
column3: it is extra and unneeded stuff floating around.  There should be a routine in checksetup.pl that can remove those.  Right now the params the need removing are:  * newemailtech  * newemailtechdefault  * changedmail  * prettyasciimail  Attachment 33631 [details] has the routines that would need to be added to checksetup.pl.  There was a question on IRC how requiring defparams.pl would react w/out having globals.pl for the SendSQL routine (even though SendSQL is inside a sub that isn't called by WriteParams).

column2: Bugzilla-General%TAB%checksetup.pl won't compile if DBI is not installed%TAB%checksetup.pl won't compile if DBI is not installedTried to install Bugzilla on a local machine here that hasn't had database stuff  on it before
column3: and got this as the *only* output when trying to run checksetup.pl:  Uncaught exception from user code:         Uncaught exception from user code:         Can't locate DBI.pm in @INC (@INC contains: /usr/lib/perl5/5.6.0/i386- linux /usr/lib/perl5/5.6.0 /usr/lib/perl5/site_perl/5.6.0/i386-linux /usr/lib/ perl5/site_perl/5.6.0 /usr/lib/perl5/site_perl .) at ./checksetup.pl line 560.         main::BEGIN() called at DBI.pm line 560         require 0 called at DBI.pm line 560 BEGIN failed--compilation aborted at ./checksetup.pl line 560.  There is a "use DBI" statement directly above the MySQL version checking code
column4: at  the line number mentioned.  Commenting out that line solved the problem
column5: since  DBI is already loaded at that point due to the version checking looking for it  earlier in the file.  With that line commented out
column6: I got the usual version  checks
column7: and the paragraph stating that I needed to install things like you  normally expect.  The version check for MySQL still succeeds (meaning DBI was  indeed loaded) after DBI is installed.  Patch is forthcoming.

column1: 83619%TAB%991341246%TAB%13272%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Bugzilla-General%TAB%QuickSearch always crashes Netscape 4.76 & 4.77 on Unix%TAB%QuickSearch always crashes Netscape 4.76 & 4.77 on UnixThanks to Gerv for the report.  0. Lauch Netscape 4.76 or 4.77 on Unix 1. Go to http://bugzilla.mozilla.org 2. Type `foo' in the QuickSearch text box 3. Press return. column1: 83872%TAB%991512312%TAB%10297%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Bugzilla-General%TAB%Bugzilla depends on DBD::mysql
column3: not the Mysql module%TAB%Bugzilla depends on DBD::mysql
column4: not the Mysql modulenowhere in any Bugzilla file is there any dependency on "Mysql" EXCEPT for the  version check for it in checksetup.pl.  The current version of Bugzilla uses DBI for everything
column5: and as such
column6: requires  DBD::mysql instead.  Recent installs with up-to-date versions of DBD::mysql have also started giving a  warning that $dbh->func("_ListTables") was deprecated
column7: and should use  $dbh->tables instead.  Checking the changelogs on DBD::mysql
column8: versions prior to  1.2209 had a broken $dbh->tables call that had a problem when the database was  empty (which is the case the first time checksetup.pl runs)
column9: so I'm nominating  version 1.2209 as the minimum version for the version checks.  The patch I'm about to attach removes the version check for Mysql
column10: adds a check  for DBD::mysql 1.2209
column11: and also changes the _ListTables routine to use  $dbh->tables.

column1: 84285%TAB%991789528%TAB%8667%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Bugzilla-General%TAB%enter_bug.cgi : asking user to pick from a list of 0 products%TAB%enter_bug.cgi : asking user to pick from a list of 0 productsProblem.  I setup Bugzilla 2.12. I turned on both usebuggroups and usebuggroupsentry. I created a product "ProdX". I created 10 users. I assigned 2 of these users to be members of the "ProdX" group. I clicked to enter a new bug. I logged in as one of the users who is NOT in the "ProdX" group. I got the Enter Bug screen saying "First
column3: you must pick a product on which to  enter a bug" but there were no products listed. So I couldn't get any further.  Solution.  When the user is not permitted to enter bugs against any products
column4: return a  sensible message rather than asking them to pick from a list with 0 elements.

column1: 84338%TAB%991820439%TAB%27300%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Requirements%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Creating/Changing Bugs
column3: attachment and request management%TAB%RFE: enhanced attachment and request tracking
column4: RFE: enhanced attachment
column5: patch and request tracking%TAB%RFE: enhanced attachment and request tracking
column6: RFE: enhanced attachment
column7: patch and request trackingI recently developed an enhancement to Bugzilla to enable users to edit information about attachments and flag them with statuses.  Attachment statuses show up in the attachment list when viewing a bug
column8: and users can query for bugs with certain attachment statuses.  Other features of the tool include the ability to mark attachments invalid
column9: causing their descriptions to appear with strike-through style when viewing a bug
column10: and the ability to view all attachments on one page in a series of iframes.  I also created a second enhancement to Bugzilla to enable users to request changes to data in Bugzilla from other users (f.e. setting a status on an attachment).  Requests generate email to the requestee and go into a queue stored in a database table.  When the requestee makes the change specified in the request
column11: the request is marked fulfilled in the database
column12: and the requester is notified via email.  Users can also view the queue of pending requests to track them.  Both enhancements are implemented as a set of new files (module
column13: script
column14: templates) along with hooks into several existing Bugzilla scripts.  While both enhancements were developed to meet specific mozilla.org needs to track the patch review process
column15: they both store their definitions (attachment statuses and request types) in database tables so they can be completely customized for other uses.  I set up a test Bugzilla installation and filed a bug with several patches to demonstrate the tools:  http://landfill.tequilarista.org/myk/bzpacman/show_bug.cgi?id=3  Create an account for yourself if you want to experiment in a more significant way.  http://landfill.tequilarista.org/myk/bzpacman/  I am writing technical documentation on the enhancements and will post it as it becomes available.

column1: 84596%TAB%991944775%TAB%29580%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Bugzilla-General%TAB%syncshadowdb doesn't specify user/pass for dump and restore%TAB%syncshadowdb doesn't specify user/pass for dump and restoreI attempted to set up a shadow database in bugzilla 2.12 (under Linux)
column3: and  while the results screen after submitting the parameter changes didn't give any  errors
column4: it didn't work.  Bugzilla created the new database
column5: but it was empty
column6: and every other bugzilla change gave an error at the bottom
column7: as it tried to  modify a non-existant shadowdb table.  Tracked it down to the syncshadowdb program
column8: which contains      system("mysqldump -l -e $db_name $tablelist > $tempfile");  to dump the DB
column9: and then      open(MYSQL
column10: "cat $tempfile | mysql $extra " .          Param("shadowdb") . "|") || die "Couldn't do db copy";  to restore into the shadowdb.  The problem seems to be that it's not passing a username/password to the mysql  apps
column11: so the dump and import both get refused.  Once I hardcoded in the  appropriate user/pass for my db
column12: shadowing started working.  Now I might just be doing something else wrong
column13: since I couldn't find old or  current bugs about this problem
column14: and I can't be the only one trying to use a  shadow
column15: but we'll see... :)

column1: 85832%TAB%992455541%TAB%11608%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Requirements%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Bugzilla-General%TAB%quicksearch should strip spaces before sending to show_bug.cgi%TAB%quicksearch should strip spaces before sending to show_bug.cgiIf QuickSearch is just given a number and some spaces
column3: it sends the user to show_bug.cgi.  That's good
column4: but it sends the spaces to show_bug.cgi too
column5: which means that next time I see the bug on a bug list
column6: it won't appear as a visited link.  Also
column7: bugzilla currently rejects bug URLs with spaces (I think this is temporary).

column1: 85833%TAB%992455602%TAB%11608%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Bugzilla-General%TAB%show_bug.cgi doesn't accept space after bug number%TAB%show_bug.cgi doesn't accept space after bug numberBugzilla's show_bug.cgi rejects URLs that have a space after the bug number
column3: saying that the bug number is invalid.  I think this is a recent regression.  This is particularly annoying because I often double-click a bug number (which selects the space after the number)
column4: paste it into a QuickSearch form
column5: and press enter.  (QuickSearch not stripping the space causes problems even without show_bug.cgi rejecting the URL
column6: so I filed bug 85832 on QuickSearch.)

column1: 86001%TAB%992529594%TAB%8593%TAB%VERIFIED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Architecture%TAB%Bugzilla: Other moz.org Issues
column2: Bugzilla Helper
column3: Bugzilla-General%TAB%"Description" box is too damn small%TAB%"Description" box is too damn smallThe "Description" box has only four visible lines. The actual/expected results/steps to reproduce boxes have six
column4: and the "aditional info" has nine.  I think the "Description" box should be larger. Four visible lines is way too few when you are trying to articulate an argument (like a complex feature request). Also
column5: it's the most important part of the bug when the behavior can't be reproduced (again
column6: feature requests)
column7: and even when it can be reproduced
column8: to explain why it's wrong. This paragraph has six lines
column9: and would be harder to type in that small four-line box.  It should have 11 lines like the "Description" box in http://bugzilla.mozilla.org/enter_bug.cgi?product=mozilla.org  (And yeah
column10: the page source says rows=3. Why it has four lines and not three
column11: I don't know.)

column1: 86029%TAB%992546778%TAB%15223%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Requirements%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Administration%TAB%create permission restrictions for createaccount.cgi
column3: create permission restrictions for createaccount.cgi (prevent people from creating accounts)%TAB%create permission restrictions for createaccount.cgi
column4: create permission restrictions for createaccount.cgi (prevent people from creating accounts)How can I administer such that only the adminstrator can create user login accounts ? Vanilla bugzilla allows anyone to create a login account.  The following possibilities should probably exist: a. allow account creation based on email request b. allow account creation by guests who are not logged in c. allow account creation by people who are logged in and have some privelege  while enabling b doesn't make much sense
column5: it might not unreasonable to  discourage people from creating multiple accounts.  c is probably what most people want. a is probably worthy of it's own bug.  The specific privelege for C is probably the most interesting question
column6: should  it be something you can control by adding people to a group
column7: or like a checkbox  in edit users
column8: or ...

column1: 86168%TAB%992615081%TAB%17856%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Requirements%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: User Interface%TAB%Bugzilla should use template pages instead of hard-coded HTML%TAB%Bugzilla should use template pages instead of hard-coded HTMLRe discussion with Myk
column3: I suggest we start moving the hard-coded HTML code into templates. Myk suggests we use the Template Toolkit ( see http://www.template-toolkit.org/ ) and since he's used it already in bug 84338 and it appears to be stable and supported
column4: why not?  The purpose here is to make Bugzilla's install and customization much easier
column5: and to allow for simpler upgrading
column6: additionally. It does have high impact
column7: of course
column8: but it can be done in phases.

column1: 86300%TAB%992754818%TAB%30690%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Testing%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Bugzilla-General%TAB%Multiple usage of potentially uninitialized variables in globals.pl/GetBugLink%TAB%Multiple usage of potentially uninitialized variables in globals.pl/GetBugLinkI am getting the following warnings in my web server (Apache) log file when  running bugzilla locally:  Use of uninitialized value at globals.pl line 795 (#1) Use of uninitialized value at globals.pl line 796 (#1) Use of uninitialized value at globals.pl line 797 (#1) Use of uninitialized value at globals.pl line 799 (#1) Use of uninitialized value at globals.pl line 800 (#1)  This appears to be due to NULLs being returned by the SQL query a few lines  back.  Also occurs on earlier lines 791 and 792 (and causes similar problems within  the value_quote() calls on the next lines.  Further investigation reveals that the reason I am seeing this error is that I  have the text ... see bug <number> ... in my bug description
column3: where <number> is  not a bugnumber existing in the bugzilla database (I was referring back to bug  numbers in a previous database I had migrated from into bugzilla).  GetBugLink should check for this case
column4: and not produce a link if it occurs.

column1: 86328%TAB%992785437%TAB%17856%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla

column4: Deleting bugs doesn't delete dependent records properlyfter some testing while doing a fix for # I ran sanitycheck and
column5: lo and behold
column6: Bad value 44 found in longdescs.bug_id  Bad value 45 found in longdescs.bug_id  Bad value 46 found in longdescs.bug_id  Bad value 47 found in longdescs.bug_id  Bad value 48 found in longdescs.bug_id   These bugs are the exact bugs I was testing deletes from. I haven't tried reproducing yet
column7: but a quick look at the code makes it seem quite possible. I don't think anybody has actually turned on delete
column8: and that's why nobody's been bitten
column9: AFAICS (which also explains why shadow db corruption wasn't reported even when using $db->do/query instead of SendSQL).

column1: 86397%TAB%992843480%TAB%6793%TAB%VERIFIED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Requirements%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Creating/Changing Bugs
column3: attachment and request management%TAB%Add autosense to attachment
column4: Add autosense to attachment (mime-type)%TAB%Add autosense to attachment
column5: Add autosense to attachment (mime-type)Having to specify the attachment type semse like a waste of time. Why cant  bugzilla just autosense the attachment type. When a browser uploads a file the "Content-Type" is automaticlly send along with  the file ala: Content-Type = image/gif  You can try it at: http://gemal.dk/browserspy/upload.html  And if bugzilla doesn't recieve any contenttype we just ask for it.

column1: 86447%TAB%992859861%TAB%17856%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Bugzilla-General%TAB%ChangeFieldType doesn't properly support changing to a NOT NULL type%TAB%ChangeFieldType doesn't properly support changing to a NOT NULL typeAs per bug 9352 final comments
column3: ChangeFieldType won't recognize a NOT NULL target type. In doing do
column4: it will always try to realter the table
column5: since it thinks both field types are different (when in truth
column6: the type string isn't parsed properly).  The fix in 9352 triggers this bug
column7: and it shows in checksetup.pl always reporting the following message (no matter how ALTERed the table is):  Updating field type version in table bugs ... old: varchar(64) new: varchar(64) not null

column1: 86651%TAB%992932725%TAB%4897%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Bugzilla-General%TAB%contrib/cvs-update.sh sets sticky dates%TAB%contrib/cvs-update.sh sets sticky datesWhenever bugzilla is updated via the cvs-update.sh script it sets stick dates on all bugzilla files.  This has the downside that individual files can't be updated (unless the -A tag is used) and changes can't be commited.  What the patch I'm about to upload does is changes it so '-A' gets used when updating (to remove any sticky dates/tags).  It still logs the command w/the -D so that a change can backed out of the running install.

column1: 87404%TAB%993239965%TAB%4412%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Requirements%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Creating/Changing Bugs
column3: attachment and request management%TAB%Attachments don't work if you need to log in again.
column4: Attachments don't work if you need to log in again
column5: Attachments don't work if you need to log in again or use user matching
column6: Attachments don't work if you need to use user matching%TAB%Attachments don't work if you need to log in again.
column7: Attachments don't work if you need to log in again
column8: Attachments don't work if you need to log in again or use user matching
column9: Attachments don't work if you need to use user matchingI have an IP that rotates between page loads.  For most things
column10: it's just a hassle
column11: but when I tried to upload an attachment the other day
column12: the following happened:  (a) I was logged on
column13: I uploaded the attachment. (b) I then got a log in screen after I did the upload. (c) It then complained I had uploaded an empty attachment.  Apparently the attachment got lost.  I retried and it worked OK the second time (I was lucky with my IP).  Apparently this is difficult or impossible to fix.  But it indicates that cookieless operation doesn't work at all.  If that's the case
column14: we should either fix it (Dave indicated there was alternative ways we could do this since we could detect cookieless operation out front)
column15: or detect it and tell them they can't upload attachments.

column1: 87405%TAB%993240292%TAB%4412%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Requirements%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Query/Bug List%TAB%Change columns on stored query loses title.%TAB%Change columns on stored query loses title.We have a nice snazzy title that appears on stored queries now.  Woohoo!  However
column3: if you hit 'Change Columns' then it gets converted to a big query URL and even though the query title seems to still be in the URL
column4: the title no longer appears on the page.  I believe it should.  It would probably be nice to fix this by just adding an ordering to the end and not convert it to a big query URL.  And while you're in the area
column5: please explain why the big URL has this:  "namedcmd=2.12+Bugzilla+Bugs&newqueryname=2.16+Bugzilla+Bugs"  "2.16 Bugzilla Bugs" is the relevant query
column6: whereas "2.12 Bugzilla Bugs" is a query I haven't had since ... well ... you know ...

column1: 87407%TAB%993241965%TAB%4412%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Query/Bug List%TAB%Weird screen.
column3: Rotating IP causes problems with buglist.cgi%TAB%Weird screen.
column4: Rotating IP causes problems with buglist.cgiIt seems my wonderful rotating IP is bringing out all manner of Bugzilla bugs today.  Try this one out:  Go to a stored query.  The pondering screen seems to redirect you to a URL that is just "buglist.cgi".  That's bad in itself (not bookmarkable)
column5: but at the moment we'll just assume that in the meantime my IP changed.  Hence you'll see a logged out footer.  Click on "Change Several Bugs At Once".  At this point
column6: if you're not lucky enough for your IP to become the right one again
column7: you'll get a log in screen that looks absolutely lovely.

column1: 87411%TAB%993249369%TAB%13272%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Bugzilla-General%TAB%needed for mod_perl: Bugzilla should be in its own namespace
column3: move global Bugzilla subroutines into modules
column4: move global Bugzilla subroutines into modules (remove CGI.pl and globals.pl)%TAB%needed for mod_perl: Bugzilla should be in its own namespace
column5: move global Bugzilla subroutines into modules
column6: move global Bugzilla subroutines into modules (remove CGI.pl and globals.pl)Richard Walters wrote  (in news://news.mozilla.org:119/uhexcrkll.fsf%40qualcomm.com ):  For one thing
column7: I put all the scripts into a "Bugzilla namespace"
column8: by doing a "package Bugzilla".  I stripped out all the subroutines from "CGI.pl" and "globals.pl"
column9: putting them into a new file called "Bugzilla.pm" which I put in /etc/httpd/lib/perl/Bugzilla.pm
column10: and load when the web server starts
column11: by having "PerlRequire Bugzilla.pm" in my /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf file.  That way they need only be compiled once when the server first starts.  The good news of putting Bugzilla into its own namespace:  It does not pollute the global namespace.  The bad news:  I had to do global search-replaces for all instances of "$::"
column12: replacing with "$Bugzilla::".  Same with arrays and hashes.

column1: 87596%TAB%993442039%TAB%31068%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Bugzilla-General%TAB%improper definition of $::components in globals.pl%TAB%improper definition of $::components in globals.plThe datastructure for $::components looks like this    hash {      scalar "product" => array []   }  however
column3: on line 504
column4: if the product is not defined in the component list
column5: the value for that product gets set to a scalar rather than an anonymous array.  This bug bit me when I was upgrading from 2.10 to 2.12: I had not component defined for a certain product.  Here is the patch that solved it (the patch is made agains the current revision [1.95]):  cvs -z9 -q diff globals.pl (in directory D:\dev\moz\mozilla\webtools\bugzilla\) Index: globals.pl =================================================================== RCS file: /cvsroot/mozilla/webtools/bugzilla/globals.pl
column6: v retrieving revision 1.95 diff -r1.95 globals.pl 504c504 <             $::components{$i} = ""; --- >

column4: but added to the group. If I use ".*@domain.tld" instead of "*.domain.tld" the user is added to the correct group

Result: The name @netscape.com is not a valid username.                  --------------------------------------  Expected: The name <u>@netscape.com is not a valid username. column3: not just with CC.  I think it affects the new-bug form as well as the form for modifying existing bugs. This is a security hole. Fixing bug 26257 would make the security hole less exploitable

column1: 87772%TAB%993502486%TAB%10297%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Testing%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Bugzilla-General%TAB%Installation instructions for Mac OS X and Darwin%TAB%Installation instructions for Mac OS X and DarwinBugzilla itself runs just dandy on Mac OS X.  However
column3: if you want to use the  charting features
column4: you need Chart::Base
column5: and GD
column6: and of course libgd.  libgd also  requires libttf
column7: libjpeg
column8: and libxpm.  These items are pretty hard to get working  on Mac OS X if you try to do it on your own.  Fortunately there's Fink
column9: a utility  similar in nature to CPAN but which installs common GNU software.  In order to  avoid creating conflicts with the software Apple installs by default
column10: Fink  creates its own directory tree at /sw where it installs all of its software.   This in turn causes another issue with the GD Perl module because it assumes your  libraries are in /usr/lib instead of getting it from your path.  I'm writing up a little better instructions which I'll be attaching shortly.

column1: 87779%TAB%993507123%TAB%4412%TAB%VERIFIED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Bugzilla-General%TAB%Don't automatically create account on login page.%TAB%Don't automatically create account on login page.When someone enters an invalid login
column3: they have an option to e-mail themselves a password.  However
column4: if the account does not exist
column5: it is created.  This is undesirable because useless accounts can be created by accident.  I suggest that we say that the account does not exist
column6: and below that message place the normal createaccount.cgi form (with the email address filled in).  As a bonus
column7: the user will be able to enter their real name at account creation time.  This would of course mean that this code should be refactored so it is usable from all cgis that might want a login
column8: as well as createaccount.cgi.

column1: 87795%TAB%993514372%TAB%4412%TAB%VERIFIED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Requirements%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: User Accounts%TAB%Prevent account abuse.
column3: Creating an account should wait for confirmation (prevent account abuse)
column4: Creating an account should send token and wait for confirmation (prevent user account abuse)%TAB%Prevent account abuse.
column5: Creating an account should wait for confirmation (prevent account abuse)
column6: Creating an account should send token and wait for confirmation (prevent user account abuse)We should do something to prevent someone from creating accounts for other people they shouldn't
column7: and those accounts polluting the system.  Two options present themselves:  (1) Put a 'last login date' or 'everloggedin' option on the profiles table.  Then after a specific period
column8: delete the account if it has never been used (and hence can be deleted safely one would hope). (2) Before creating the account
column9: store the email address
column10: real name
column11: password
column12: and a unique token in a temporary table
column13: and send a confirmation email to the user including a validation URL with the token embedded which will create the account.  Either mechanism would require a clean up job to clean up old accounts/tokens.  This could be done in a cron job or it could be tied to another task
column14: for example when an account is created and the cleanup hasn't occurred for a day.  I would prefer option 2.  Unvalidated accounts will take less space
column15: clean up will be faster
column16: the max userid number will be less
column17: and there's no chance a bug might make the account be used somewhere while being marked as never logged in.

column1: 87801%TAB%993533013%TAB%8667%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Testing%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Email%TAB%sendmail results error checking
column3: Better error messages when mail sending fails%TAB%sendmail results error checking
column4: Better error messages when mail sending failsSomeone here was using Bugzilla and had forgotten their password. They filled in their e-mail address and clicked on "E-mail me a password".  The webpage returned back said  "Password has been emailed No recipient addresses found in header The password for the e-mail address  paul.thomas@sse.ie has been e-mailed to that address."  They never got an email!  I looked into it and it turned out that parameter passwordmail has accidently  been saved with an extra newline in the email address and looked like this  From: bu zilla@machine.sse.ie To: %mailaddress% Subject: Your Bugzilla password. ... etc ...  I took out the newline
column5: saved the new parameter and it worked fine.  I reckon that the message "No recipient addresses found in header" was returned  from sendmail
column6: yet "The password for the e-mail address paul.thomas@sse.ie has  been e-mailed to that address" was displayed
column7: so it looks to me as if the  return code from the call the sendmail is not been checked properly.  Although this bug only reveals itself when the system is not set up properly
column8: I  still reckon that any "dodgy" return code checking from sendmail is worth  reporting.

column1: 87840%TAB%993547010%TAB%27226%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Requirements%TAB%Bugzilla

column8: let me fix the original bug ID without reopeningOften bugs get duplicated and afterwards the duplication is corrected to point to another bug. The given URL is a good example of that. The current way of reopening and marking as duplicate afterwards is rather clumsy. I therefore suggest Adding a field  "Mark bug as duplicate of #[   ]"  to the possible resolutions.

column1: 87958%TAB%993580620%TAB%10297%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Testing%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Installation%TAB%Bugzilla should require MySQL 3.23.2
column3: Bugzilla should require MySQL 3.23.x
column4: Bugzilla should require MySQL 3.23.32
column5: Bugzilla should require MySQL 3.23.41%TAB%Bugzilla should require MySQL 3.23.2
column6: Bugzilla should require MySQL 3.23.x
column7: Bugzilla should require MySQL 3.23.32
column8: Bugzilla should require MySQL 3.23.41The mysqldump utility provided with versions of MySQL earlier than 3.23.2 has a  bug in it which causes column indexes with names that match built-in function  names to be encoded in the output in such a way that when re-importing them they  get interpretted as the functions instead of as index names.  This completely  chokes any attempt to restore bugzilla databases from a mysqldump-generated  backup.  In order to protect all the good sysadmins out there that do regular backups (not  to mention sites that use the shadowdb)
column9: we should make sure they are using a  version of MySQL that includes the mysqldump that has this fixed.  (That or explicitly name the index on the versions column in the bugs table -  which is another option...)

column1: 87983%TAB%993592119%TAB%4412%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla

column4: when I ran it on b.m.o
column5: it didn't know me and it gave me a nice set of information about the system it was running on that could be useful to a system cracker.  It's probably OK on other systems though because on my local installation it falls over before it gets this far.  Let's not scare admins anymore with its name and trash it.

column1: 88179%TAB%993679030%TAB%27556%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Bugzilla-General%TAB%Bug charts broken under Windows (Software Error
column3: Base.pm line173)%TAB%Bug charts broken under Windows (Software Error
column4: Base.pm line173)On my BZ-installation 2.10 the Bug Charts works well (no bug ;-).  But I have another server with the same config (W2K server and IIS) and a BZ  2.13 installation - here the Bug Charts are broken
column5: I think because of the  datasets stuff: a) If I select only one Status of the Chart datasets (eg. REOPENED)
column6: I get no  Software Error
column7: but the grafik is borken (.../graphs/-All-_REOPENED%3A.png). b) If i select two or more (eg. NEW and REOPENED) I get a Software Error in  Base.pm line 173).  My collectstats.pl works well - if I take a look in the data/mining-files they  are updated every night. Permissions on the directory are the same as under  BZ2.10 (both: system and IIS). If I take a look in the /graph folder
column8: the files are all about 0KB and have the  name <Product>_<firstState> without! any extension (eg. png). A second state is  never added to any filename (like <Product>_<firstState>_<secondState>.png).  So perhaps
column9: this error results out of the Windows conventions for naming the  files
column10: which are differnt about unix ?  I also started a thread in the NG
column11: but I found nobody with working Bug Charts  (>=BZ2.12) under Windows.

column1: 88797%TAB%994050059%TAB%4897%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Bugzilla-General%TAB%Running a mass change clears group bits.%TAB%Running a mass change clears group bits.the change multiple bugs form calls process_bug.cgi
column3: which now assumes if it  doesn't find anything mentioning groups that everything is being cleared
column4: since  empty checkboxes aren't transmitted.  When we were using select boxes for the  groups
column5: the absense of a select box altogether resulted in no action.  The  easiest way to fix this is probably going to be to create some sort of  "--do_not_change--" value for groups on the mass change page...  If we have to go  this far
column6: maybe we should go ahead and implement being able to change groups from  the mass change page...  (isn't there a bug for that already somewhere?)

column1: 89272%TAB%994232727%TAB%9285%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Testing%TAB%XP Toolkit/Widgets
column2: Bugzilla Helper
column3: Bugzilla-General%TAB%Resizing "dropdown" menus aren't handled gracefully%TAB%Resizing "dropdown" menus aren't handled gracefullyFrom Bugzilla Helper: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:0.9.2+) Gecko/20010703 BuildID:    2001070321  If an option is selected in a dropdown menu (a <select> menu that is) and the menu is resized by items being removed afterwards it will go blank and the list will be much longer than it actually should be.  Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1.Go to above URL 2.In "Product" select "Browser or editor" 3.In "Component" select "xpidl" (at the bottom) 4.In "Product" select "Mail/News"   Actual Results:  The "Component" list gets confused. It's longer than it should be (lots of white lines fill out the dropdown menu)  Expected Results:  If currently selected option is removed
column4: mozilla should move to the top of the menu. It should only be blank if *all* options are removed.

column2: Bugzilla-General%TAB%different handling of disabledtext%TAB%different handling of disabledtextcreating a user by using editusers.cgi (administrative) the field disabled text  will be set to '' (because the edit field is empty) Using the login screen (results in globals.pl:InsertNewUser) the field will not  be set and keeps NULL  This results in hang of edit user created in the second way - the details  screen (editusers.cgi?action=edit&user=...) will never be opened  You can fix this by setting disabled text to '' in globals.pl

column2: Query/Bug List%TAB%"changed from" missing from boolean chart%TAB%"changed from" missing from boolean chartFor changes to bugs
column3: we can already do "changed to"
column4: "changed by"
column5: "changed  before" and "changed after"
column6: so why not "changed from"
column7: since the information  is available in the same database table anyway?  This allows queries for a specific change e.g. [status] [changed from] [VERIFIED] And [status] [changed to  ] [REOPENED]  Finds bugs that have been reopened from a verified state (as opposed to plain  resolved).  Proposed patch follows...

column1: 91664%TAB%995629610%TAB%27300%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Requirements%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Creating/Changing Bugs
column3: attachment and request management%TAB%Bugzilla does not enforce a maximum patch/attachment size.%TAB%Bugzilla does not enforce a maximum patch/attachment size.Bugzilla does not enforce a maximum patch/attachment size
column4: even though it stores attachments in a LONGBLOB column with a theoretical limit of (2^32 - 1) characters
column5: a practical limit of 16MB based on the maximum value of mysqld's max_allowed_packet
column6: and an actual limit equivalent to the value of that variable.  More significantly
column7: the lack of any size enforcement leads to reckless and wanton uses of space
column8: for example the posting of unnecessary and/or non-compressed attachments (like highest-quality JPEG screen-shots). Bugzilla should enforce a maximum patch/attachment size.

column1: 91761%TAB%995708246%TAB%4412%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Requirements%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Administration%TAB%New group for sanity check.
column3: Sanity Check is too broadly accessible%TAB%New group for sanity check.
column4: Sanity Check is too broadly accessibleWe should introduce a new system group to allow administrators to specify who can perform sanity checks.  In bug #54556 we did a bandaid and made sure you needed editbugs
column5: but I don't think this is sufficient long term.

column1: 91808%TAB%995773072%TAB%4412%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Administration%TAB%Sanity check duplicates table.%TAB%Sanity check duplicates table.I added a few referential checks for the new duplicates table to a patch on bug #76140.  However
column3: we could go further.  In particular:  Check that each bug that's been marked duplicate has an entry in the duplicates table. Check that each bug that has an entry in the duplicates table that's been marked duplicate.  In particular the second check goes further than the existing referential check
column4: so maybe it should be removed from the above mentioned patch.  But anyway
column5: rather than doing these two checks separately
column6: I suggest we do them together
column7: in a similar way as a list merge:  (1)  Get a sorted list of bugs marked duplicate as per the bugs table. (2)  Get a sorted list of bugs marked duplicate as per the duplicates table. (3)  Compare the two lists using a similar technique as you would to merge the lists into one sorted list - continually compare the heads.  If both heads are the same
column8: remove them
column9: otherwise remove the lesser head and split out an error.

column1: 91903%TAB%995864695%TAB%10297%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Bugzilla-General
column3: Bug Import/Export & Moving%TAB%Insecure dependency in require at importxml.pl line 59.%TAB%Insecure dependency in require at importxml.pl line 59.As reported by tinderbox:  Insecure dependency in require while running with -T switch at /home/ianh/ tinderbox/mozilla/webtools/bugzilla/importxml.pl line 59.  This is only killing the Perl 5.00503 tinderbox.  All the 5.6 tinderboxen are  passing it.  This is a 2.14 release blocker.  Resolution of this bug will require  either making Perl 5.00503 happy or deciding to require a newer version of Perl.

column1: 92253%TAB%996042721%TAB%21302%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Architecture%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Query/Bug List%TAB%Boolean chart makes very wide web pages from query.cgi%TAB%Boolean chart makes very wide web pages from query.cgiIt is difficult to quickly review what is currently in a boolean chart with  lots of OR operators
column3: as the page generated is too wide to fit in a window. It  would be more readable if each OR term was on a different row
column4: but more tightly  packed than the AND terms.  Something roughly along the lines of the way it is shown in queryhelp.cgi.  I patched query.cgi our local bugzilla
column5: and the results seem to look ok to me.

column1: 92263%TAB%996046529%TAB%4412%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Bugzilla-General%TAB%Don't output SQL commands before the footer.%TAB%Don't output SQL commands before the footer.The other day when there was problems with shadow database syncing on mozilla.org
column3: people (including me) were getting an SQL INSERT statement that was an account creation
column4: just before their footer.  This had the account's unencrypted password
column5: as well as the person's email.  Now we don't store cleartext passwords in 2.14
column6: but we still shouldn't be outputting this garbage.  I've been told that apparently it was trying to remove leftover shadow sync commands.  That's all well and good
column7: but it shouldn't be outputting those commands.

column1: 92266%TAB%996048019%TAB%4412%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Creating/Changing Bugs%TAB%Generate software error if truncation occurs on bugs activity table.%TAB%Generate software error if truncation occurs on bugs activity table.Supposedly there won't be any more truncation "in practice" on the activity table now bug #55161 is fixed
column3: but let's not risk it - we could add heaps of dependencies at once.  We should add an assertion to check it fits
column4: and generate a software error (or a nicer error if you can) if the assertion fails.

column1: 92500%TAB%996157486%TAB%32848%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Administration%TAB%OmniWeb browser "corrupts" params file with hard returns (^M)
column3: Bugzilla Bug
column4: not Mozilla bug - OmniWeb browser "corrupts" params file with hard returns (^M)
column5: OmniWeb browser "corrupts" params file with hard returns (^M)%TAB%OmniWeb browser "corrupts" params file with hard returns (^M)
column6: Bugzilla Bug
column7: not Mozilla bug - OmniWeb browser "corrupts" params file with hard returns (^M)
column8: OmniWeb browser "corrupts" params file with hard returns (^M)When updating parameters using the OmniWeb web browser for Mac OS X
column9: the browser apparently submits hard returns (^M) instead of newlines for textarea stuff.  So for example
column10: I get a hard returns in the newchangedmail headers after the "From:" header which makes sendmail (8.11.4) barf (it thinks there's no recipient)  See also bug report 89211 which helped me solve the error
column11: and now I know where it's coming from.  Not sure if this is considered a browser bug or a Bugzilla bug
column12: but it would be a quick fix to doeditparams.cgi to strip these out (looks like it's already translating \r\n to \n).

column1: 92515%TAB%996161463%TAB%5500%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Requirements%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Creating/Changing Bugs%TAB%Should be able to change resolution without re-opening...%TAB%Should be able to change resolution without re-opening...Quite often
column3: users will use the wrong resolution when resolving a bug.  For example
column4: using (FIXED instead of INVALID or WORKSFORME).  In order to change the resolution
column5: I need to re-open and and re-resolve.  This generates two e-mails for nitpicking so I don't usually do it.    It should be possible to change the resolution without having to reopen. Possibly there could be a permission which controlled who had this privilege.

column1: 92552%TAB%996189454%TAB%4412%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Architecture%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Creating/Changing Bugs%TAB%Separate out reassignment actions.%TAB%Separate out reassignment actions.We should separate out the reassignment actions from the standard status-changing actions.  Basically it should look like this.  ... < > Resolve bug
column3: mark it as a duplicate ...  < > Don't change assignee < > Reassign bug to ... < > Reassign bug to default assignee of component  [ ] Reassign bug to default QA of component  Tell me again why assignee and QA work differently?  Sure
column4: assignee has a real name for the existing value
column5: and can't be blank
column6: but I don't see why we can't just make the assignee like the QA contact and add a real name to the QA contact.  Or if you prefer
column7: make the QA contact work like the assignee.  Then the above options would be consistent between the two.

column1: 92593%TAB%996223682%TAB%4412%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Requirements%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Bugzilla-General%TAB%Moving a bugs product removes all voters from the bug.%TAB%Moving a bugs product removes all voters from the bug.When you move a bug from one product to another
column3: all the voters get removed from the bug.  While this is often necessary because otherwise you could exceed your vote limit per product
column4: it is not always necessary.  Instead we could reduce people's votes to the highest value that:  (a) Means that the user's total vote count doesn't exceed what is allowed by the product. (b) Means that the user's bug vote count doesn't exceed what is allowed by the product (see also bug #28882).  Of course often this might mean we reduce it to 0
column5: and hence we remove them from the bug.

column1: 92713%TAB%996334723%TAB%27300%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Bugzilla-General%TAB%show_activity.cgi displays zeroes as non-breaking spaces%TAB%show_activity.cgi displays zeroes as non-breaking spacesWhen "show_activity.cgi" retrieves a list of changes from the database
column3: it converts null values
column4: empty strings
column5: and zeroes to a non-breaking space (" ")
column6: presumably so the bug activity table formats correctly in browsers that format table cells differently if they contain no content.  Zeroes are content and are usually significant (they represent "boolean false" in certain fields)
column7: so they should not be converted to a non-breaking space.

column1: 92905%TAB%996533021%TAB%31826%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Administration%TAB%editusers.cgi errors in apache errorlog: fetchrow_array failed%TAB%editusers.cgi errors in apache errorlog: fetchrow_array failedWhenever I edit a user (select a userentry from the list of users shown by a query to enter the user-edit page) I get this in the apache errorlog: DBD::mysql::st fetchrow_array failed: fetch() without execute() at globals.pl line 195. [Tue Jul 31 08:37:07 2001] editusers.cgi: DBD::mysql::st fetchrow_array failed: fetch() without execute() at globals.pl line 195. In my globals.pl it is this line: ------ sub MoreSQLData {     if (defined @::fetchahead) {     return 1;     } FAILS HERE->    if (@::fetchahead = $::currentquery->fetchrow_array) {     return 1;     }     return 0; } --------- I traced the problem to line 163 in editusers.cgi (the original 2.12 version) which looks like this:  while (MoreSQLData()) { The problems seems to be that this while comes just after an if like this: if (MoreSQLData()) { ... } while (MoreSQLData()) { ... It seems that MoreSQLData() gives this error if it is called twice when there is no more sqldata. So either the bug is that MoreSQLData does not support being called twice in this case
column3: or the bug is that editusers.cgi does it. The problem occurs when the user is not a member of any isbuggroup groups. I solved the problem at my installation by putting the whileloop inside the if loop. I guess a more elegant solution would be to rewrite MoreSQLData so it supports being called repeatedly even if there is no more data
column4: but I did not know how to do this.

column1: 93511%TAB%996837659%TAB%5500%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Administration%TAB%Removing user screws up CC list.%TAB%Removing user screws up CC list.I removed a user that was CCed on a couple of bugs.  When I go back to that bug
column3: the user is listed as __UNKNOWN__.  When I try and remove it
column4: I get:  	The name __UNKNOWN__ is not a valid username. Either you misspelled it
column5: or the person has not registered for a Bugzilla account.   There's a few ways to fix this bug:  1. Allow removal of __UNKNOWN__ users from the CC list 2. Remove user from CC lists when it is deleted. 3. Prevent deleting user that is CCed to bugs.

column2: User Interface%TAB%Remove the Reset button!%TAB%Remove the Reset button!Since the dawn of HTML/2.0 (or whenever the FORM tag appeared)
column3: people have been adding that worthless and destructive button next to the Submit button on EVERY form I see.  As the maintainer of RPGBoard
column4: a message board script
column5: it was one of the first things I removed
column6: as the pain of clearing away an hour's worth of typing was enough to start bitching at the one who put the button there.  Let's start/continue a trend and remove it here!

column1: 94618%TAB%997363438%TAB%32899%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Bugzilla-General%TAB%passwords with plus character don't work%TAB%passwords with plus character don't workWhen upgrading from 2.10 to 2.13
column3: one user has a password with a  plus character.  This password did not work after upgrade. Reentering this password in editusers.cgi never gave an error
column4: and the user was not able to log in.  Everything is fine if we use a password without a plus character.  This is probably related to the passwords previously being sent via GET method where spaces are mapped to plus.  url_decode of CGI.pl has a tr/+/ /
column5: so I tried entering the password with space instead of + with little success.  I want to investigate more
column6: but won't have time for several days
column7: and believe the release is soon.

column1: 94850%TAB%997497897%TAB%4412%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Requirements%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Bugzilla-General
column3: Incoming Email%TAB%Integrate bug_email into the main code.
column4: Integrate bug_email into the main code. (inbound submission and reply)%TAB%Integrate bug_email into the main code.
column5: Integrate bug_email into the main code. (inbound submission and reply)Besides the feature presently possible. I'd like to see: a) Allow product/component selection based on the "To:" address.    (We have only one product and a few compontents a     support-unix@ and support-win@ is easier than bugs@ + @product one +        @component unix b) Allow the automatical addition of the user to the database (it the account     doesn't exist yet). This would provide a simpler access for in-house support    and would be like Debian's bug tracking system (minus "reportbug") c) It should be possible to separate mailserver and webserver.    .procmailrc is run on the mailserver and    ConnectToDatabase(); has to be run on the bugzilla-webserver.

column1: 94952%TAB%997578920%TAB%4412%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Architecture%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Bugzilla-General%TAB%Bugzilla doesn't have longdescs.
column3: Bugzilla doesn't have longdescs?%TAB%Bugzilla doesn't have longdescs.
column4: Bugzilla doesn't have longdescs?A.3.1.  What about Loki Bugzilla?  Loki Games has a customized version of Bugzilla available at http://fenris.lokigames.com. From that page
column5: You may have noticed that Fenris is a fork from Bugzilla-- our patches weren't suitable for integration --and a few people have expressed interest in the code. Fenris has one major improvement over Bugzilla
column6: and that is individual comments are not appended onto a string blob
column7: they are stored as a record in a separate table. This allows you to
column8: for instance
column9: separate comments out according to privilege levels in case your bug database could contain sensitive information not for public eyes. We also provide things like email hiding to protect user's privacy
column10: additional fields such as 'user_affected' in case someone enters someone else's bug
column11: comment editing and deletion
column12: and more conditional system variables than Bugzilla does (turn off attachments
column13: qacontact
column14: etc.).  --------------------------------  We've had the longdescs table which does this for ages now.  The presence of this statement implies we don't.

column1: 94953%TAB%997579171%TAB%4412%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Architecture%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Documentation%TAB%You can add fields to Bugzilla?%TAB%You can add fields to Bugzilla?A.4.14.  Does Bugzilla allow fields to be added
column3: changed or deleted? If I want to customize the bug submission form to meet our needs
column4: can I do that using our terminology?  Yes.  -----------------------------  This is rather uninformative and potentially misleading.  It should say that you need to hack the code.  I thought I read a comment elsewhere about something similar where it did say this but I can't find it now.  Even better if it could include the recipe for how you modify the code to support new fields.  There is some information on this in the newsgroup.

column1: 95008%TAB%997620363%TAB%29274%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Requirements%TAB%Bugzilla

column3: so that old
column4: now fixed bugs don't clutter up the table.  That makes sense for fixed bugs
column5: but some bugs (eg alt tooltips not displaying
column6: or junkbuster being broken (bug 38488)) are not really bugs
column7: and so will never be fixed. That doesn't stop people reporting them again.  The duplicates page should list INVALID and WONTFIX bugs. Maybe only list those with new dupes in the last month or so?

column7: they can only see if it they know the bug number.  It still doesn't show up in their buglists.  The buglist needs to show these bugs to them also.

column2: Bugzilla-General%TAB%Remove $onebug cruft.%TAB%Remove $onebug cruft.There's code in editkeywords.cgi and queryhelp.cgi that works around an old bug in MySQL:      SendSQL("SELECT keyworddefs.id
column3: keyworddefs.name
column4: keyworddefs.description
column5: COUNT(keywords.bug_id)
column6: keywords.bug_id              FROM keyworddefs LEFT JOIN keywords ON keyworddefs.id =                   keywords.keywordid              GROUP BY keyworddefs.id              ORDER BY keyworddefs.name");     while (MoreSQLData()) {         my ($id
column7: $name
column8: $description
column9: $bugs
column10: $onebug) = FetchSQLData(); 	...         if (!$onebug) {             # This is silly hackery for old versions of MySQL that seem to             # return a count() of 1 even if there are no matching.  So
column11: we              # ask for an actual bug number.  If it can't find any bugs that             # match the keyword
column12: then we set the count to be zero
column13: ignoring             # what it had responded. 	...  I dont' think having workarounds for this is a good idea in the first place because it's liable to occur in other places and people won't remember to do the workaround.  So let's kill the code and update the MySQL version requirement.  This bug does not occur on landfill (v3.22.30) and I'm told mothra runs v3.22.32.  The main problem is we're not sure what version it was fixed in.  I can see various references to COUNT
column14: but I suspect this is the fix:  3.21.22: FIX COUNT(*) problems when the WHERE clause didn't match any records. (Bug from 3.21.17.)  If this is the case
column15: our current version check (which I'm told is 3.22.5) should already cover it.  But if we can't verify the fixed version
column16: we could change the requirement to v3.22.30.

column2: Creating/Changing Bugs%TAB%Reopening en masse fails.%TAB%Reopening en masse fails.There is an option for reopening on the bulk change page.  However it doesn't work.  It references the "id" parameter several times which does not exist for bulk changes.  It looks like this problem _may_ have been introduced during the duplicates table introduction
column3: as there's some code there that references the duplicates table.  Or that just may have added more broken code.  This should be looping through @idlist or some such.  There's also similar code for mass duplicate marking.  Although this probably can't get called from the UI
column4: it probably still can be called by entering a special URL.  It should be dealt with too.

column1: 95564%TAB%997917422%TAB%27300%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Bugzilla-General%TAB%buglist.cgi uses an INNER JOIN
column3: buglist.cgi uses an INNER JOIN
column4: not supported in MySQL 3.22.5%TAB%buglist.cgi uses an INNER JOIN
column5: buglist.cgi uses an INNER JOIN
column6: not supported in MySQL 3.22.5INNER JOINs are supported on mysql version 3.23.0 and up
column7: and mysql version 3.23.17 and up supports the ANSI SQL syntax for this command.  Bugzilla
column8: however
column9: requires only mysql 3.22.5
column10: so it should either not contain INNER JOINs or Bugzilla should require a newer version of mysql.  Requiring a newer version is a more complex issue that should probably involve
column11: among other things
column12: polling Bugzilla installations
column13: so in the meantime I am attaching a patch to remove the INNER JOIN from buglist.cgi and replace it with an equivalent expression supported by all relevant versions of mysql.

column1: 95857%TAB%998058557%TAB%27300%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Bugzilla-General%TAB%process_bug.cgi looks for user with empty address in cc: list
column3: process_bug.cgi sees blank address in cc: list (__UNKNOWN__)%TAB%process_bug.cgi looks for user with empty address in cc: list
column4: process_bug.cgi sees blank address in cc: list (__UNKNOWN__)process_bug.cgi appears to be parsing the cc: list such that it thinks the user submitting changes has entered a user with a blank email address into cc: field.  Apparently this is triggered if the user enters two commas in a row into the cc: list field
column5: although some users claim that it happened when they didn't do that.  Bug 95798 exacerbates this problem
column6: as does the presence of a user on b.m.o. with a blank login name (email address).

column1: 95889%TAB%998083249%TAB%10297%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Bugzilla-General%TAB%Lots of spurious commas in the activity table on keywords%TAB%Lots of spurious commas in the activity table on keywordsAfter the b.m.o update
column3: the activity table is showing lots of extra commas in the entries where more than one keyword was added or removed.  I suspect this code is at fault:              my @old = split(/[
column5: $oldvalue);             my @new = split(/[
column7: $newvalue);  The keywords entries already had comma-space for the separators
column8: and the above split only matches a single character.  Thus we wound up with a lot of null records accidently created on a lot of bugs.  The patch for this will need two parts to it. a) fix the conversion algorithm so it doesn't bite any other installs b) go back and scan the activity table for keywords entries and fix the corruption it caused to the existing entries (remove extra commas from the records) so when b.m.o updates next
column9: it fixes it.

column4: but does not record the addition of the + keyword
column5: even though it happens.

column1: 95923%TAB%998117045%TAB%34095%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Architecture%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Creating/Changing Bugs%TAB%Red banner indicating what fields may be changed
column3: Don't let user change fields they aren't allowed to change.%TAB%Red banner indicating what fields may be changed
column4: Don't let user change fields they aren't allowed to change.After being very thorough in filling out the bug form I was able to be blinded by the bright red banner several times saying I could not do such and such to certain fields because I was not the owner etc.  If I cannot do certain things to certain fields
column5: you should not allow me to do them in the first place
column6: or you might just list the fields on the next page that were not changed for the indicated reasons instead of beating me up for trying to be thorough.

column1: 95970%TAB%998176231%TAB%10297%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Requirements%TAB%Bugzilla
column2: Documentation%TAB%Need a Reviewers Guide for Bugzilla
column3: Need a "Bugzilla Hacking Guide"%TAB%Need a Reviewers Guide for Bugzilla
column4: Need a "Bugzilla Hacking Guide"We need to create a "Reviewers Guide" for Bugzilla which contains preferred coding practices and also common gotchas that that reviewers often overlook because they're not something you'd normally think about.  The situation this last weekend at bugzilla.mozilla.org is a real good example of a tragedy that could have been prevented had a common perl gotcha been noticed by either of the two people who reviewed a certain patch.  (See bug 95890 if you want all the gory details - short story is b.m.o is having to pull a backup and reconstruct a good portion of the bugs_activity table)  To start off the common gotchas section: 1) Any variable included inside a regular expression must be quoted with \Q..\E unless the variable is intended to contain a regular expression. 2) avoid using regexps for grep if you're looking for an exact match
column5: instead use a code block to compare equivalency ( grep($_ eq $matchstr
column6: @list); )  These two are what bit us in the butt on b.m.o the other day.I'm sure we can come up with more
column7: too.  In this guide
column8: we should also come up with some standard testing procedures for testing new code before it's checked into cvs.  We have landfill at our disposal
column9: but it doesn't seem to be enough.  Is there stuff we can add to landfill to assist testing?  Or certain tests we need to remember to perform?  Maybe we should make a requirement in the reviewer guide that a list of things that need to be tested to validate a given patch should be included in the bug report before the patch is tested and checked in...  A checklist of things that patch stands a remote chance of affecting
column10: etc.... thoughts anyone?

column2: Section A.7.6 doesn't explain "sendmailnow" very well%TAB%Section A.7.6 describes doesn't explain "sendmailnow" well
column3: Section A.7.6 doesn't explain "sendmailnow" very wellSection A.7.6 describes eliminating the "-ODeliveryMode=deferred" from the sendmail invocation
column4: then mentions that the "sendmailnow" param exists
column5: but doesn't say what it does.  Since activating the "sendmailnow" param removes the -O command line flag
column6: there is no reason they need to modify source to accomplish that.  All they need to do it turn on "sendmailnow" in editparams.

column1: 97185%TAB%998911840%TAB%17856%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla-General
column2: Query/Bug List%TAB%make_select should add a newline after each option%TAB%make_select should add a newline after each optionIn CGI.pl
column3: there is a nice function called make_select. This nice function
column4: however
column5: doesn't add a newline to each option
column6: making it quite impossible to see the options listed nicely in a view source window (or in any dump for that matter). It's quite easy to add a "\n" to each option
column7: and it would only increase page size by a few bytes.

column1: 97191%TAB%998913240%TAB%4412%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Architecture%TAB%Documentation
column2: attachment and request management%TAB%Fixes to get attachments working under Win32 not documented.%TAB%Fixes to get attachments working under Win32 not documented.Had to fix references to <code>... it may be that <code> is unsupported in Docbook 4.1
column3: which is what the Guide is using.  I changed refs to <function>
column4: which is more accurate considering that binmode() is a function anyway...  Last bug for 2.14 release.  Just compiled it all to HTML
column5: trying to find any terrifically nasty errors
column6: and checking in.

column1: 97192%TAB%998913490%TAB%4412%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Architecture%TAB%Documentation%TAB%Bug reporting reference to old component.%TAB%Bug reporting reference to old component.The Guide page geninstall.html says to report a bug to the old component.  It should either be updated to the new product
column2: or changed to refer to the home page which will always contain the correct instructions.  Given people need to go online
column3: this shouldn't be a problem.  That's what I did for the README.

column1: 97290%TAB%998974251%TAB%34532%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Installation & Upgrading%TAB%checksetup.pl should report about errors in localconfig%TAB%checksetup.pl should report about errors in localconfigIf an error occurs when calling localconfig
column2: none of the variables are defined.  If checksetup.pl detects undefined variables
column3: it simply adds them to  localconfig. Thus an erroneous localconfig will grow with every call to  checksetup.pl
column4: without giving a notice to the user.

column1: 97469%TAB%999071934%TAB%10297%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Email Notifications%TAB%Assignee/QA/Reporter/CC don't get email on restricted bugs%TAB%Assignee/QA/Reporter/CC don't get email on restricted bugsThis is an offshoot from bug 39816
column2: which made it possible for the Assignee
column3: QA
column4: Reporter
column5: and CC list to see a bug even if they were not a member of the group the bug was restricted to.  However
column6: processmail currently will not send email to users who are not members of the groups the bug is in.  Processmail needs to check for the role bits and act appropriately.

column1: 97471%TAB%999072184%TAB%10297%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Requirements%TAB%Creating/Changing Bugs%TAB%assignee_accessible and qa_accessible are unnecessary%TAB%assignee_accessible and qa_accessible are unnecessaryI'd like to recommend removing the QA and Assignee checkboxes from the form.  The QA and the Assignee should ALWAYS be able to see a bug.  Perhaps if the reporter specifies that a bug belongs to a group that the assignee is not a member of
column2: it should prompt the filer to confirm that they want to put the bug in that group
column3: or use that assignee (but still allow it since the assignee would be able to see it anyway).  Same for QA.

column1: 97582%TAB%999133662%TAB%33998%TAB%CLOSED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Reporting/Charting
column2: Documentation%TAB%Broken link to download Chart::Base module%TAB%Broken link to download Chart::Base moduleThe Chart::Base module is unavailable from the link in the Bugzilla Guide. Can anyone suggest another link for downloading it? Without that I cannot see charts...

column1: 97588%TAB%999138077%TAB%15150%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Architecture%TAB%Installation & Upgrading%TAB%localconfig should mention access.conf as well as httpd.conf (for old apache)%TAB%localconfig should mention access.conf as well as httpd.conf (for old apache)The localconfig generated by the 2.14 checksetup mentions the bugzilla <Directory> block in an httpd.conf file.  In older Apache installs
column2: this sort of info could have been stored in an access.conf  file as well
column3: couldn't it?  Trivial patch to follow to mention this.

column1: 97590%TAB%999138734%TAB%15150%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Architecture%TAB%User Interface%TAB%Confusing link on show votes page??%TAB%Confusing link on show votes page??On the show votes page
column2: the first column is the bug number
column3: but if you click on this bug number link
column4: it takes you to the votes for that bug
column5: and not to show_bug.cgi
column6: which is where just about all the other links containing a bugid take you.  Is it just me that finds this a bit confusing/inconsistant.  Perhaps there should be a column with a text link that says 'show the votes for bug X'

column1: 97657%TAB%999170899%TAB%33620%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla-General%TAB%bug_form_pl_sillyness() used in defparams.pl causes subroutine redefined error%TAB%bug_form_pl_sillyness() used in defparams.pl causes subroutine redefined error==> /var/log/apache/bugzilla.lubricants-oil.com/error.log <== Subroutine bug_form_pl_sillyness redefined at 	/usr/lib/bugzilla/lib/perl5/bug_form.pl line 34 (#1)          (W redefine) You redefined a subroutine.  To suppress this warning
column2: say              {     	no warnings;     	eval "sub name { ... }";         }      [Thu Aug 30 14:13:20 2001] show_bug.cgi: Subroutine bug_form_pl_sillyness redefined at /usr/lib/bugzilla/lib/perl5/bug_form.pl line 34.  Simply change bug_form_pl_sillyness() to defparams_pl_sillyness() to fix the issue:  diff -u defparams.pl.orig defparams.pl --- defparams.pl.orig	Mon Aug 27 09:00:39 2001 +++ defparams.pl	Thu Aug 30 15:01:14 2001 @@ -45
column4: 7 @@  # Shut up misguided -w warnings about "used only once".  For some reason
column5: # "use vars" chokes on me when I try it here.   -sub bug_form_pl_sillyness { +sub defparams_pl_sillyness {      my $zz;      $zz = %::param_checker;      $zz = %::param_desc;

column1: 97668%TAB%999174834%TAB%22500%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Installation & Upgrading
column2: Documentation%TAB%.htaccess created by checksetup.pl is bad%TAB%.htaccess created by checksetup.pl is badThe default .htaccess created by checksetup.pl was incorrect.  There is a line in it like:  <FilesMatch ^(.*\.pl|localconfig|processmail|syncshadowdb)$>  That "^" should not be there.  A "diff -c" with the correction is:  *** checksetup.pl       Thu Aug 30 16:31:20 2001 --- checksetup.pl.orig  Thu Aug 30 16:31:03 2001 *************** *** 569
column3: 575 ****       open HTACCESS
column4: ">.htaccess";       print HTACCESS <<'END';   # don't allow people to retrieve non-cgi executable files or our private data ! <FilesMatch (.*\.pl|localconfig|processmail|syncshadowdb)$>     deny from all   </FilesMatch>   END --- 569
column5: 575 ----       open HTACCESS
column6: ">.htaccess";       print HTACCESS <<'END';   # don't allow people to retrieve non-cgi executable files or our private data ! <FilesMatch ^(.*\.pl|localconfig|processmail|syncshadowdb)$>     deny from all   </FilesMatch>   END

column1: 97894%TAB%999283041%TAB%21768%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Architecture%TAB%Query/Bug List%TAB%check run remembered query when choosing a remembered query%TAB%check run remembered query when choosing a remembered queryCurrently there are two radio button that control the select list for remembered queries. One to run the query and one to forget it. I think that remembered queries are pretty neat
column2: and I use it all the time
column3: but I run into the following: 1. Select one of the remembered query 2. Submit. Get thousands of hits. The reason of course is that selecting one of the remembered queries doesn't automatically set the "run the remembered" query radio button. I think it should.  Most people run remembered queries hundreds of times and only delete any occasionally. Consequently it's reasonable to make the assumption that when somebody selects a remembered query
column4: the user wants to run it
column5: not delete it. With such an enhancement
column6: deleting a query would be no more difficult than it is today (select the query
column7: check the "delete this query" radio button
column8: submit)
column9: but   running one would be easier and less error prone: select the query
column10: submit.

column7: Create a user preferences infrastructure (became 'General Settings')Originally
column8: it was thought that the emailprefs table would also hold general prefs.  The thinking has changed and we need a general prefs table.  See bug 73665 for the emailprefs table.  user prefs such as the one in bug 7710 would go here.  The 'mybugslink' from profiles table might also want to get moved here.  And any new user prefs should go here as well.  Mark dependencies as needed.

then please\n"; > print "click here.
\n"; > > PutFooter(); > > exit(); >} If something went mad

column1: 98368%TAB%999672629%TAB%34907%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%Bugzilla-General%TAB%The DBI connect in globals.pl does not use the db_port defined in localconfig%TAB%The DBI connect in globals.pl does not use the db_port defined in localconfigIn globals.pl
column2: the DBI->connect does not use the db_port variable defined in localconfig.  Which seems strange to me since checksetup.pl does use it. A $::driver variable will need to be added when new databases are brought into the mix
column3: such as Pg (PostgreSQL). It will need to be added to localconfig
column4: checksetup.pl and globals.   $::driver = 'mysql';  $::db = DBI->connect("DBI:$::driver:host=$::db_host;database=$name;port=$::db_port"
column5: $::db_user
column6: $::db_pass)  	    || die "Bugzilla is currently broken. Please try again later. " .         "If the problem persists
column7: please contact " . Param("maintainer") .        ". The error you should quote is: " . $DBI::errstr;  Matthew Tuck [:CodeMachine]

column1: 98468%TAB%999717253%TAB%24475%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Architecture%TAB%Administration%TAB%Sample value for emailregexp allows empty user names%TAB%Sample value for emailregexp allows empty user namesIn defparams.pl
column2: the description of the emailregexp parameter is given as  follows: 'This defines the regexp to use for legal email addresses.  The default tries to  match fully qualified email addresses.  Another popular value to put here is  <tt>^[^@]*$</tt>
column3: which means "local usernames
column4: no @ allowed.'  If you use the given sample value for emailregexp
column5: Bugzilla will accept an empty  string as a valid user name.  Also note the missing quote mark at the end of the string.  I recommend changing the description to: 'This defines the regexp to use for legal email addresses.  The default tries to  match fully qualified email addresses.  Another popular value to put here is  <tt>^[^@]+$</tt>
column6: which means "local usernames
column7: no @ allowed."'

column1: 98507%TAB%999755537%TAB%15150%TAB%RESOLVED%TAB%FIXED%TAB%Development%TAB%User Interface%TAB%Should  DBNameToIdAndCheck() do a PutFooter?%TAB%Should  DBNameToIdAndCheck() do a PutFooter?Currently
